projectFiles

Class DatabaseConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • projectFiles.DatabaseConnector

  • public class DatabaseConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a collection of methods for connecting and communicating with the system database
    Author:
    Luke Heavens & Ben Carr

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addContact(long tweeterId, long retweeterId)
      This method stores the ids of two twitter users to indicate that there has been some interaction If the combination of user ids exists then we ignore the insertion
      void addUsers(twitter4j.User user)
      This method takes a user and will add desired fields into the database using a prepared statement If the user already exists with this id, the information will be updated
      void addUserTermPair(long userId, int wordId, int userCount)
      This method adds a pairing between a user and a term along with an occurrence count If the pairing already exists, the occurrence count is only updated if it is larger than previously seen This allows significant terms to be identified
      void addUserVenue(long userId, java.lang.String venueId)
      This method adds a user venue pairing if the pairing doesnt already exist This indicates a user has visited a location
      void addVenues(fi.foyt.foursquare.api.entities.CompleteVenue venue)
      This method takes a venue and will add desired fields into the database using a prepared statement If the venue already exists with this id, the information will be updated
      int addWord(java.lang.String term)
      This method adds a frequently used term to the database that doesn't already exist Returns the id of the term if it was added
      void closeConnection()
      This method closes the database connection
      boolean establishConnection()
      This function attempts to establish a connection to a database
      java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getRetweetersOfUser(long userId)
      This function gets user details for users that have retweeted a given user If users are found, details are stored in a list of hashmaps and returned

      This function takes a userId and gets frequently user terms

      This function takes a userId and gets information of venues they have visited

      This function gets user details for users that have been retweeted by a given user If users are found, details are stored in a list of hashmaps and returned
      java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getVenueVisitors(java.lang.String venueId)
      This function takes a venueId and gets information of users that have visited
      int getWordId(java.lang.String term)
      This method will look up a word in the database and will return the wordId if it exists.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> showUser(java.lang.String username)
      This function takes a username and performs a lookup in the database If a user is found, details are stored in a hashmap and returned

    • Method Detail

      • establishConnection

        public boolean establishConnection()
        This function attempts to establish a connection to a database
        Returns:
        returns true if the connection was established else false

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        This method closes the database connection

      • addUsers

        public void addUsers(twitter4j.User user)
        This method takes a user and will add desired fields into the database using a prepared statement If the user already exists with this id, the information will be updated
        Parameters:
        user - - The user object to store

      • addVenues

        public void addVenues(fi.foyt.foursquare.api.entities.CompleteVenue venue)
        This method takes a venue and will add desired fields into the database using a prepared statement If the venue already exists with this id, the information will be updated
        Parameters:
        venue - - the venue object to store

      • addContact

        public void addContact(long tweeterId,
              long retweeterId)
        This method stores the ids of two twitter users to indicate that there has been some interaction If the combination of user ids exists then we ignore the insertion
        Parameters:
        tweeterId - - The id of a user who has tweeted
        retweeterId - - The id of a user who has retweeted the tweeters tweet

      • addWord

        public int addWord(java.lang.String term)
        This method adds a frequently used term to the database that doesn't already exist Returns the id of the term if it was added
        Parameters:
        term - - The term used
        Returns:
        returns wordId of word if added, -1 otherwise

      • addUserTermPair

        public void addUserTermPair(long userId,
                   int wordId,
                   int userCount)
        This method adds a pairing between a user and a term along with an occurrence count If the pairing already exists, the occurrence count is only updated if it is larger than previously seen This allows significant terms to be identified
        Parameters:
        userId - - The id of a user
        wordId - - The id of a term
        userCount - - The number of times the user has seen the word

      • addUserVenue

        public void addUserVenue(long userId,
                java.lang.String venueId)
        This method adds a user venue pairing if the pairing doesnt already exist This indicates a user has visited a location
        Parameters:
        userId -
        venueId -

      • getWordId

        public int getWordId(java.lang.String term)
        This method will look up a word in the database and will return the wordId if it exists. If it cannot find an index, it will return -1
        Parameters:
        term - - The word to look up
        Returns:
        - Index of word or -1 if not found

      • showUser

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> showUser(java.lang.String username)
                                                              throws DatabaseException
        This function takes a username and performs a lookup in the database If a user is found, details are stored in a hashmap and returned
        Parameters:
        username - - The user to look for
        Returns:
        - A hashmap of details
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • getRetweetersOfUser

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getRetweetersOfUser(long userId)
                                                                                               throws DatabaseException
        This function gets user details for users that have retweeted a given user If users are found, details are stored in a list of hashmaps and returned
        Parameters:
        userId - - The tweeter id
        Returns:
        A List (one for each retweeter) of hash maps (user details)
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • getUserRetweets

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getUserRetweets(long userId)
                                                                                           throws DatabaseException
        This function gets user details for users that have been retweeted by a given user If users are found, details are stored in a list of hashmaps and returned
        Parameters:
        userId - - The retweeter id
        Returns:
        A list (one for each tweeter) of hash maps (user details)
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • getUserLocations

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getUserLocations(long userId)
                                                                                            throws DatabaseException
        This function takes a userId and gets information of venues they have visited
        Parameters:
        userId - - The if of the user to lookup
        Returns:
        - A list of (one for each venue visted) hash maps (venue details)
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • getUserKeywords

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getUserKeywords(long userId)
                                                                                           throws DatabaseException
        This function takes a userId and gets frequently user terms
        Parameters:
        userId - - The if of the user to lookup
        Returns:
        - A list of (one for each term used) hash maps (term and count)
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • showVenue

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> showVenue(java.lang.String venueName)
                                                               throws DatabaseException
        This function takes a venue name and performs a lookup in the database If a venue is found, details are stored in a hashmap and returned

      • getVenueVisitors

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getVenueVisitors(java.lang.String venueId)
                                                                                            throws DatabaseException
        This function takes a venueId and gets information of users that have visited
        Parameters:
        venueId - - The id of the venue to lookup
        Returns:
        - A list of (one for each user who has visited) hash maps (user details)
